TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi serializable beforefieldinit XamlSchemaException extends System.Xaml.XamlException

Docs.summary: The exception that is thrown when a binding system or another schema representation system for XAML reports an exception to the schema context.

remarks.format: ## Remarks The <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaException> is thrown by several cases in the CLR binding support classes that provide the schema context for .NET Framework XAML Services (<xref:System.Xaml.XamlXmlReader>, <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriter>, or <xref:System.Xaml.XamlServices>). A <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaException> is typically passed as the inner exception for other exceptions, such as the <xref:System.Xaml.XamlMember.IsUnknown%2A?displayProperty=nameWithType>-true property for a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlObjectWriterException>, so it should be uncommon to catch a <xref:System.Xaml.XamlSchemaException> directly unless you are implementing a component such as a specialized object writer.

Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified message that describes the error.

Public Sub New (message As String, innerException As Exception)

Attribute.AttributeName: System.Runtime.TargetedPatchingOptOut("Performance critical to inline this type of method across NGen image boundaries")

Docs.param: The message that describes the exception. The caller of this constructor is required to ensure that this string has been localized for the current system culture.
The exception that is the cause of the current exception. If the parameter is not , the current exception is raised in a block that handles the inner exception.
Docs.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class with a specified error message and a reference to the inner exception that is the cause of this exception.

remarks.format: ## Remarks An exception that is thrown as a direct result of a previous exception should include a reference to the previous exception in the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property. The <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property returns the same value that is passed into the constructor, or `null` if the <xref:System.Exception.InnerException%2A> property does not supply the inner exception value to the constructor.
